page.title: 03COMMUNICATIONS FOR VILLAGE.
page.content: The world outside is vital to the community as there is no post office, the nearest being at Woburn Sands or Cranfield both three miles away from the village.The majority of residents have telephones in their homes and there is a kiosk in Salford and in the district of Lower End. British Telecom issue a guide on how to obtain the best service. Information is also obtainable on subjects such as telephone numbers, the weather, travel news, correct time, recipes and entertainment. Postal Services are important and consist of two collections and deliveries Monday to Friday and one collection and delivery on Saturdays. Television gives world and national news several times daily keeping everyone up to date even in the most isolated and lonely places.
